verses.kjv: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
verses.ct: Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded:

verses.kjv: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
verses.ct: "Can any person actually benefit God? Even a wise person only benefits himself.

verses.kjv: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
verses.ct: Does the Almighty gain anything from your righteousness? Does he profit if you live a blameless life?

verses.kjv: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?
verses.ct: Is it because of your deep reverence for him that he corrects you? Is that why he brings you to judgment?

verses.kjv: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?
verses.ct: Isn't your wickedness enormous? Aren't your sins endless?

verses.kjv: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.
verses.ct: You demanded collateral from your relatives for no reason, and you stripped the clothes off people who had nothing.

verses.kjv: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
verses.ct: You refused water to the exhausted and withheld food from the starving.

verses.kjv: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.
verses.ct: The powerful man owned the land, and the privileged person lived on it.

verses.kjv: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
verses.ct: You sent widows away with nothing, and you crushed the strength of orphans.

verses.kjv: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;
verses.ct: That is why traps surround you on every side, and sudden terror overwhelms you.

verses.kjv: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.
verses.ct: That is why darkness blocks your sight, and a flood of water engulfs you.

verses.kjv: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
verses.ct: Isn't God in the highest heaven? Look at the highest stars — see how far above they are!

verses.kjv: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?
verses.ct: Yet you say, 'What does God know? Can he judge through thick darkness?'

verses.kjv: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.
verses.ct: 'Dense clouds hide him so he can't see, and he just walks along the dome of heaven.'

verses.kjv: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?
verses.ct: Are you going to follow the ancient path that wicked people have walked?

verses.kjv: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:
verses.ct: They were snatched away before their time, and their foundations were swept away by a flood.

verses.kjv: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?
verses.ct: They told God, 'Leave us alone!' and asked, 'What can the Almighty possibly do to us?'

verses.kjv: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.ct: Yet he was the one who filled their homes with good things. But the thinking of the wicked is something I reject.

verses.kjv: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.
verses.ct: The righteous see their downfall and celebrate, and the innocent mock them, saying,

verses.kjv: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
verses.ct: 'Our prosperity hasn't been destroyed, but fire has consumed what they had left.'

verses.kjv: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
verses.ct: Submit yourself to God and make peace with him; that is how good things will come to you.

verses.kjv: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
verses.ct: Please accept instruction from his mouth, and store his words deep in your heart.

verses.kjv: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
verses.ct: If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored. If you remove sin far from your household,

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
verses.ct: then you can toss your gold in the dust and treat the gold of Ophir like ordinary stream pebbles.

verses.kjv: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
verses.ct: The Almighty himself will be your treasure, and you will have an abundance of silver.

verses.kjv: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
verses.ct: Then you will find your joy in the Almighty, and you will look up to God with confidence.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
verses.ct: You will pray to him, and he will answer you, and you will fulfill the promises you made to him.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
verses.ct: Whatever you decide to do will succeed, and light will shine on your path.

verses.kjv: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.
verses.ct: When others are brought low, you will say, 'There is hope!' because God rescues the humble.

verses.kjv: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
verses.ct: He will even rescue those who are not innocent — they will be delivered because of the cleanness of your hands."
